line_1: Long as I please abroad I bide,
line_2: And do not fear my Wife will chide,

line_1: Here hood-winkt Ignorance is seen to bide
line_2: Near to the dome a magic pair reside

line_1: What hell it is this shouldring throng to bide,
line_2: Ah little knows the wretch, that hath not try'd,

line_1: Their little blaze, to those who durance 'bide;
line_2: And o'er that awful portal shadows glide.

line_1: When dinner's set I'll with you bide,
line_2: And aye be serving by your side;

line_1: An hour with thee — a pleasant hour to bide.
line_2: The sober sage wise tomes will cast aside,

line_1: Well pleased thy gamesome taunts to bide;
line_2: No more I'll loiter by thy side,
